title: C
description: A powerful, low-level programming language known for its efficiency and direct memory manipulation
usage: System programming, embedded systems, and performance-critical applications

title: C++
description: An extension of C that supports object-oriented programming, known for its performance and flexibility
usage: Application development, game development, and systems programming

title: C#
description: A modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft, known for its strong typing and performance
usage: Enterprise applications, game development (Unity), and web development

title: HolyC
description: A powerful, high-level programming language used in the TempleOS operating system, known for its integration with the OS kernel.
usage: TempleOS development, scripting within the TempleOS environment

title: Objective-C
description: A general-purpose, object-oriented programming language primarily used for macOS and iOS applications before Swift.
usage: macOS and iOS application development

title: Swift
description: A modern programming language developed by Apple for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS development.
usage: Apple's ecosystem, including iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS, server-side development, machine learning.

title: JavaScript
description: A high-level, interpreted programming language primarily used for web development
usage: Web development, front-end and back-end scripting, and server-side applications

title: TypeScript
description: A strongly typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.
usage: Web development, front-end frameworks, and large-scale applications

title: Ruby
description: A dynamic, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity and productivity, often used in web development.
usage: Web development, scripting, and automation

title: Java
description: A widely used, class-based, object-oriented programming language known for its portability and robustness.
usage: Enterprise applications and backend systems

title: Go
description: A statically typed, compiled language designed by Google for performance and simplicity.
usage: Cloud computing, backend development, and networking

title: Rust
description: A memory-safe, systems programming language focused on performance and concurrency.
usage: Systems programming, embedded systems, and web assembly

title: Kotlin
description: A modern, statically typed programming language designed to interoperate with Java.
usage: Android development, backend services, and cross-platform applications

title: Perl
description: A high-level, general-purpose programming language known for its text processing capabilities.
usage: Text processing, web development, and system administration

title: Lua
description: A lightweight, high-level scripting language commonly used in game development.
usage: Game development, scripting, and embedded systems

title: R
description: A programming language primarily used for statistical computing and data analysis.
usage: Data analysis, statistical computing, and machine learning

title: Dart
description: A client-optimized programming language developed by Google for building web and mobile applications.
usage: Mobile and web application development (Flutter)

title: Scala
description: A hybrid functional and object-oriented programming language that runs on the Java Virtual Machine (JVM).
usage: Big data, distributed systems, and backend services

title: Pascal
description: A procedural programming language designed for structured programming and data structuring.
usage: Education, embedded systems, and early software development

title: F#
description: A functional-first programming language for .NET, known for its strong type inference and concise syntax.
usage: Data science, web development, and financial computing

title: Zig
description: A programming language designed for robustness, optimality, and clarity, with manual memory management and a focus on performance and safety.
usage: Systems programming, embedded systems, performance-critical applications

title: PHP
description: A popular general-purpose scripting language especially suited for web development. Known for its ease of use and deep integration with databases and servers.
usage: Web development, server-side scripting, content management systems (CMS) like WordPress

title: Julia
description: A high-level, high-performance programming language for technical computing, with syntax that is familiar to users of other technical computing environments.
usage: Data science, numerical computing, machine learning, scientific computing, and parallel computing.

title: Delphi
description: A high-level, compiled, strongly typed programming language that is based on Object Pascal, used for developing desktop, mobile, web, and database applications.
usage: Desktop applications, mobile apps, web development, and database applications.

title: Simula
description: A pioneering object-oriented programming language, considered the first object-oriented language, designed for simulation and modeling complex systems.
usage: Simulation, modeling, and early object-oriented programming.

title: Node.js
description: An open-source JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, designed for building scalable network applications.
usage: Web development, server-side scripting, real-time applications

title: Deno
description: A secure runtime for JavaScript and TypeScript, created by the original author of Node.js, designed for modern applications with built-in TypeScript support.
usage: Web development, server-side scripting, modern JavaScript/TypeScript applications

title: Bun
description: A fast all-in-one JavaScript runtime, bundler, and task runner that aims to be simpler and faster than Node.js and Deno.
usage: Web development, server-side scripting, full-stack applications, rapid prototyping

title: .NET
description: A free, open-source, cross-platform framework for building modern applications, from web apps to mobile, desktop, cloud, and more.
usage: Web development, desktop applications, mobile apps, cloud services, gaming

title: Express.js
description: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.
usage: Web applications, REST APIs, real-time applications (e.g., chat apps), microservices.

title: Spring Boot
description: A Java-based framework used to create stand-alone, production-grade Spring-based applications. It simplifies the setup and configuration of Spring applications.
usage: Web applications, microservices, REST APIs, enterprise applications.

title: Ruby on Rails
description: A web application framework written in Ruby, emphasizing convention over configuration and fast development.
usage: Web development, full-stack applications

title: Gin
description: A high-performance web framework for Go (Golang) known for its speed and efficiency in building APIs and web applications.
usage: Web development, API development, microservices

title: Angular
description: A platform and framework for building client-side applications with HTML, CSS, and TypeScript, focusing on dynamic single-page applications.
usage: Web development, single-page applications (SPA), front-end development

title: Next.js
description: A React-based framework for building server-side rendered (SSR) and statically generated web applications with support for routing, serverless functions, and more.
usage: Web development, server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation, React applications

title: Vue
description: A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. Vue can function as a web application framework capable of powering sophisticated single-page applications.
usage: Single-page applications, interactive UIs, front-end development.

title: Flutter
description: An open-source UI software development kit by Google for building natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.
usage: Mobile, web, and desktop app development

title: Electron
description: A framework for building cross-platform desktop applications using web technologies like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
usage: Desktop application development, cross-platform apps

title: Laravel
description: A popular open-source PHP framework for web application development, known for its elegant syntax, scalability, and ease of use for tasks like routing, authentication, and database management.
usage: Web application development, MVC architecture, backend API services

title: Preact
description: A fast, lightweight alternative to React, with the same modern API but a smaller footprint, designed for high-performance applications.
usage: Building fast, lightweight, and efficient user interfaces, often for projects where performance is a priority.

title: React
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly for single-page applications, focusing on component-based architecture.
usage: Web development, single-page applications (SPA), user interfaces

title: React Native
description: A popular open-source framework for building mobile applications using JavaScript and React, allowing developers to create cross-platform apps for iOS and Android.
usage: Mobile app development for iOS and Android, cross-platform development.

title: Lodash
description: A modern utility library delivering performance, consistency, and modularity for common programming tasks like data manipulation, object cloning, and function debouncing.
usage: Data manipulation, performance optimization, functional programming

title: Redux
description: A predictable state container for JavaScript apps, primarily used with React to manage the global state in a consistent and easy-to-debug way.
usage: State management, global app state, React ecosystem

title: RxJS
description: A library for reactive programming using Observables that makes it easier to compose asynchronous or callback-based code in a declarative way.
usage: Reactive programming, asynchronous programming, event handling

title: SQL
description: A standard language for managing and querying relational databases, used to retrieve, update, and manipulate data.
usage: Database management, querying, data manipulation

title: GraphQL
description: A query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries with your existing data, offering a more flexible alternative to RESTful APIs.
usage: API development, data fetching, flexible query language

title: MySQL
description: An open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) based on SQL, known for its reliability, scalability, and use in web applications.
usage: Database management, relational data storage, web applications

title: PostgreSQL
description: An open-source, object-relational database system known for its extensibility, standards compliance, and advanced features like JSON support and ACID compliance.
usage: Database management, relational and non-relational data storage, web applications

title: SQLite
description: A lightweight, self-contained, serverless SQL database engine designed for embedded and local storage applications.
usage: Embedded database, local storage, mobile applications, IoT devices
